definition[2]: to tell people about a product or service and try to persuade them to buy it, for example in a newspaper, television, or Internet advertisement
example[7]: She has signed a deal to advertise the company's haircare products.
definition[3]: to try to increase the sales or popularity of a product or event, for example by selling it at a lower price or talking about it on television
example[8]: He's in London to promote his new album.
definition[4]: to try to sell a product or service by deciding which type of people are likely to buy it and by making it interesting to them
example[9]: The collection is being marketed as clothing for climbers and skiers.
example[10]: Most companies have agreed not to market products to children under 12.
definition[5]: to tell the public about something by writing about it in newspapers, speaking about it on television etc
example[11]: He had done a lot of interviews to publicize his new book.
example[12]: The hostages' case has been widely publicized.
definition[6]: to try to make people think something is good or important by advertising or talking about it a lot on television, the radio etc. Hype is often used when you do not trust the information
example[13]: The boxing match was being hyped as the biggest fight of the decade.
definition[7]: to advertise a book, film etc by talking about it on television or radio
example[14]: Marc was on the show to plug his new play.
definition[8]: to tell people publicly about a product or service in order to persuade them to buy it
example[15]: Beer and wine are both advertised on TV.
example[16]: They were among the most heavily advertised cigarettes in the US.
example[17]: The cars are advertised as being more economical to run.
definition[9]: to inform people publicly, for example in a newspaper or magazine, that a job is available and invite them to apply for it
